page.title: 01NORTH TYNEDALE (REDESMOUTH)
page.content: This area lies in the{North Tyne valley, southeast of Bellingham. It is hilly and mainly rough pasture. The scattered farms are mainly engaged in stock rearing for sale in the local marts. There are also{wooded areas }on either side of the river, mixed conifers, including spruce and larch in the Countess Park wood, oak, ash, beech and birch in the Lee Hall area. The river{North Tyne}through the block from north to south and the Houxty Burn crosses the south west corner, joining the Tyne a little further south. A former{railway}cutting crosses the area and is now used by walkers. The population is small and scattered. Apart from a few private dwellings the rest of the buildings are{farms.}The main road from Hexham to Bellingham goes through part of the block,from Fell End to Bank Head.
